Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Goldengun42
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights with an Easyjet Holiday. Biggest plus is the hotel's location with all major attractions within walking distance. Vatican is best reached by bus though. No 64 from via nationale nearby. Walking distance from Termini railway station. No need for Taxi. Get Leonardi Express from the airport. 30 mins non stop and 14 euros for a single journey. Staff from the hotel were helpful and pointed out the main sites on arrival on a map. Room was very clean and had been recently refurbished with flat screen tv and new carpet. Bathroom a good size with modern fittings. Also a separate dressing room. Room was not huge but more than adequate. Only slight criticism was a very hard bed and pillows! Not a reason to avoid though. Room was cleaned to a very high standard. My wife and I thought the breakfast was really good. Good selection of rolls, fruit , yoghurts , meats etc. Some hot food being scrambled egg, frankfurter sausages and continental bacon. Tea and coffee on tap. Set us up for an energetic days sightseeing. In summary, a good value hotel in a safe area of Rome which is in a pretty much perfect location to visit all the sites. Couple of tips, if you can afford it, get a guided tour of the Vatican. Will help avoid the queues and makes the visit so much more interesting. Inside of the coliseum well worth seeing. Audio tour very good for about 6 euros. We loved Buiding known as "the wedding cake". Straight down via nationale. You will come to it. Take elevator to top. Great views of Rome. Relaxing cafe. A wonderful city. ( and a good hotel ! )

Reviews.Title: “Great Base, clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jensen1982
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is ideally based for a break in Rome. The room we stayed is was compact but not cramped, with a bathroom running off it.(no bath) this was made up beautifully everyday by very attentive maids. Our shower leaked/flooded out bathroom dispite our best efforts with the doors to keep the water in,, this made trips to the loo a bit damp underfoot until the room was cleaned next day. We backed onto a court yard so there was very little noise and the window opened providing a pleasant breeze. The room did have air conditioning but did not cool at this time of the year. Disappointing as no tea & coffee making facilities. TV channels not to our liking.................ok if you want the news 24/7. Breakfast was a selection of meats/croissants/cereal toast etc so not for the guys who want a hearty full english however a short walk will provide one. Reception manned 24 hours with polite proffessional staff. The Hotel is 15 mins walk form the main station & maybe 5/10 max to the metro. The metro offers an easy & efficient mode of transport & for 4 euros each you can travel for 24 hours, fab for nipping to the Spanish Steps, the Collesium the Trevi Fountain etc. Whatever you do, do not visit Mr Chows chinese restuarant around the corner!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I would pick this hotel again as it was fit for purpose & did exactley what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: RachImo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my best friend for what turned out to be an amazing holiday. The staff were very helpful and friendly and there was someone at the front desk 24 hours. They organised our transport to the airport on our return home and I hope I stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find fault and despite minor niggles we'd happily return”
Reviews.Author: Steve3674
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here and despite a few initial problems caused by our travel agency the staff were professional & understanding. The room was basic and clean with a comfortable bed. We also had a dressing area which made a big difference to how the room felt. It would have been nice to have a tea/coffee facility in the room and not having one was quite annoying. Wi-fi is charged at a reasonable rate of €5 for 3 days BUT, this will only allow one device onto the network so if you have two iPhones etc only one will connect at a time. So either pay again or log in and out. The breakfast is good with a decent selection - a hot option of some kind would have been welcomed though. It was nice to be able to get a decaff coffee and the breakfast room itself was pleasant and well lit. Other areas of the hotel could do with minor maintainable - wobbly handrails, awkward to flush toilet etc but overall it's nothing too off putting. ALL the staff were friendly and helpful and, unlike some Corfiot hotel owners, you never felt like you were being hassled to take a tour they got commission from and so on... In summary, it's a great little hotel with nice staff, in a good location and, if you check your map, you can get to most locations with relative ease. We'd return - can't say better than that.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: gypsicsoul
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and well decorated, a tad bit small but so are most rooms in central Rome. This was my second visit to Rome and I loved the location of this hotel. The Hotel is located very close to the Republica metro station and walking distance from Colosseo (15 min walk). The front desk is absolutely brilliant, not only did they give us a good exchange rate for dollars but also helped us with all the itinerary planning. We also got a good deal on the rooms by negotiating over the phone, so I suggest skip the online booking process, pick up the phone and call!

Reviews.Title: “Just the Job”
Reviews.Author: Fix32
Reviews.Content: This hotel suited us down to the ground. It's pretty central and off the main street so quite quiet. We were at a room facing onto the courtyard at the back and as it was November the Windows were closed and no noise coming from the other appartments backing onto the courtyard. The room was large and clean and although a little old fashioned and in need of updating and decorating, we didn't spend any time in the room as the sight seeing was so brilliant. Breakfast was sufficient... they could have a couple more pop up toasters as toast took for ever and everyone queuing for it. But the restaurant was clean and tidy and food good enough to set you up for the day. A reasonably priced hotel in walking distance of the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Neri23
Reviews.Content: Hotel Virgilio is a nice hotel and good location,friendly staff and relatively close to train station and attractions.Be wary of taxis, especially at the train station as they will try to charge you exorbitant rates & rip you off. The hop on hop off bus was a good way to get one's bearings of the city and see attractions.The Colosseum and Vatican City with St Peter's Basiclica and the Sistine Chapel are fantastic and not to be missed. The restaurant Pasta Love across from the hotel is reasonably priced and has great food & wine.

Reviews.Title: “Would fully recommend”
Reviews.Author: Katie H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel from 3/11 till 5/11 2012 and had a lovely time. The best part about the Hotel is the location, it is just off the main shopping street and walking distance to all the main tourist attractions. The room was a lovely size but in need of updating but lovely and clean, perfect for what we wanted. The TV only had 1 English channel (BBC World News), the staff were very helpful and spoke very good English and the breakfast was what you would expect. The only down side was the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything from the next room. Tip: If you are coming from the airport get on the Leanardo express Train into Termini station and walk to the Hotel, do not pay for a taxi its not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice room in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Murrayj
Reviews.Content: It is a small hotel with English speaking staff only a few blocks from the Coliseum and a metro stop. Restaurants and shops are all around. The room cost 78 euros for a matrimonial room which is one queen sized bed. It was clean with a nice marble bathroom. It did have a mini bar, which we did not buy from, but at least gave you a place to keep some cold beverages that you would purchase yourself. The room itself was very small. There was room on only one side of the bed to get from one end of the room to the other. There was more free floor space in the bathroom but many European hotel rooms are small so it was a good pick. We were only in Rome for two days so we were out sightseeing most of the time. They will keep your luggage if your leaving town later than the checkout time. I would recommend this hotel for price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: anerlie
Reviews.Content: May 2011, we arrived and when we didnt speak Italian to the receptionist they were very stroppy with us, the lift was only big enough for one person with a suitcase. The beds were rock solid, may aswell have slept on the floor.... not that we got much sleep from all the noise of the traffic beeping outside, and paper thin walls meaning we had to listen to the guy next door snoring at 1000 decibels, and the couple in the room on the other wall talking all night. In the morning we had to stand about waiting for a table for breakfast, only one poor woman serving. The only thing I could say was good about this place was the location, ten minutes walk to colleseum, 15 to spanish steps, 40 mins walk to vatican or go on one of the tour buses. Overall...I wouldnt recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “When they say single, they mean single”
Reviews.Author: George M
Reviews.Content: Great location about 500m from Termini train station and walking distance to Collosuem and Forum area. Handy for eateries. on the "Wallet eater/pickpocket express" bus route to the Vatican about 45 min away. The rooms can be very small, about the size of a double bed if you get a single room. but for 45 euros in Rome with a decent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jcharper
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, right in the middle of all the sights to see in Rome... excellent value, breakfast is very decent the staff is super friendly, very knowledgeable and for those of us who are English speaking and don't speak Italian... they speak excellent English! There's a major bus stop one block away... may pubs and lots of shopping just around the corner... the train station is only a 10 min walk away. There's two really nice great quality restaurants within a block... Do yourself a favour though, spend the extra 4 or 5 euros and get the superior room. It's bigger, newly renovated... just twice as comfortable as the standard rooms that I saw during my stay. My one and only complaint? Electrical outlets... or lack thereof. My room had only 1 outlet available... and the fridge was plugged into it. So, I had to unplug my fridge and swap items that I needed to power.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Zeina E
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our two-night stay in Hotel Virgilio in Rome. It was the middle of August and we turned up at the front desk of the hotel asking for a room on the same night. The person at the front desk whose name was Raffael, offered us a suite for the price of a double room. He was always very courteous, greeting guests in 4 languages with a warm smile . He was very helpful in suggesting places to visit, and pointing out ideal routes and means of transportation. The restroom of the suite was all marble so was the floor. Everything was spotless, the breakfast was decent in a lovely little breakfast area, the croissant were fresh and spongy. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the trevi fountain and the colosseum. We will definitly go back to this comfortable, conveniently located hotel in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location could do with better soundproofing!”
Reviews.Author: Rickandlisa999
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in March for 3 nights. It was recommended to me by the travel agents due to its location and proximity to the main sights of Rome. The hotel was a short walk from the train station and a taxi is not required. Our room was clean and fairly spacious but unfortunately the bed was the hardest i have ever slept (or not) in. Breakfast was continental and self service but the pastries were fresh every day and the choice was sufficient to keep us happy. The staff were polite and spoke good english and provided us with any information we required. We were able to walk to all the sights in Rome and only required a taxi once to get to Vatican City early in the morning. However, the soundproofing for the room was virtually non existent and we were able to hear word for word the conversation in the next room. Overall not a bad hotel and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for exploring the city, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Adeola80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. It was ideally situated for exploring the city by foot, within a walking distance from the Borgheze Gallery, the Palazo Venezia, the Forums. The room (a twin room) was very clean and relatively spacious. The breakfast was nice. The staff were very helpful! Will stay there again for my next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: niluanu
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very convenient. It is possible to walk down to the Colloseum and Roman Forum (we did). Termini Station and the Pantheon are a short bus/taxi ride away. The rooms are adequately sized but a bit run down with wallpaper peeling off at places. The breakfast is sufficient in terms of variety and quantity. The hotel does not have its own restaurant but there are plenty of good restaurants and pizzerias within reasonable walking distance. The staff are friendly and the front desk personnel speak English. Our room had no views and I feel that this would be true of most rooms. Rooms have air-conditioning and TV with English channels but are not equipped with tea/coffee maker. I do recommend this hotel as a very good place to stay in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: FrenchSandgroper
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to be upgraded to a suite, which was very comfortable, except that the safe did not work. Everything, including the bathroom was impeccably clean, and the sheets were exceptionally starched and ironed. The initial greeting at reception was very friendly. The breakfast was plentiful, if a little on the basic side. It would have been nice to have proper Italian coffee. The receptionist's advice for a good value local restaurant though was a waste of time as we were directed to a place just over the Via Nazionale which charged 95-100 euros/ dish!!!!! We later found another place, Al Boschetto, which was ok, but charged 4.50 euros extra for the "service", which amounted to about another 25% on top of our bill. This hotel is well placed, being about 10 minutes walk from the main railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Lirato69
Reviews.Content: The cab drivers from the airport and train stations Obviously have a deal with this hotel. They'll talk you out of going to your scheduled hotel saying that your chosen hotel is in a dangerous neiborhood ect..then haul you over to this hotel where they bring all unsuspecting tourist. You'll pay top dollar for a kinda shabbly room with semi-friendly service. It wasn't the best place to stay but it probably isnt the worst either. Tiny.. Tiny.. Elevator. Keep in mind that, If you weigh more than 150 pounds you will be taking the stairs. Breakfast was pretty decent.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get conned by the taxi drivers at the station to go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gail-in-Sydney
Reviews.Content: I lived in Italy for a year. I speak Italian. I know about the con artists that roam around the train station in Rome like cockroaches. I had carefully selected another hotel to stay at before I arrived in Rome. The taxi driver took me there only to find out it was not a hotel but a pensione. So he convinced me not to check in and he would take me to a much better place. Sucked in!! He drove me to the Hotel Virgilio; a ride that should have cost a maximum of 10 Euros and told me I had to pay 50 Euros. The hotel was marginal at best. The guys at reception were sleezy. The breakfast service was extremely disappointing and there prices were totally over the top. I would only stay here again if the only other place to spend the night was on a bench at the train station. STAY AWAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service and location!”
Reviews.Author: mdavis210
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel for a solo traveler. The desk staff were more than helpful when it came to anything. For example, for some reason they overbooked, and did not have a room for me my first night, so they found me a hotel room, and paid for the taxi to the new hotel. The next day, I checked back in, and they had a room all ready for me. Massimo and his group was eager to accomodate to anything I needed.

Reviews.Title: “fraudulant activity”
Reviews.Author: davidwest78
Reviews.Content: very close to the main areas They took a pre authorisation on my credit card of 230 euro without my knowledge or consent. but infact it was not a credit card its a debit card which means i may have to wait up to 3 weeks to get my money back. even though i paid in cash on arrival which they were told when booking. when i rang to complain after finding this out. the man on reception was very rude to me. I,m very angry to think that a hotel can hold money on someones bank account without prior knowledge or agreement which means this is fraudulant activity which i,m still awaiting to get cleared up. Also having to pay for wifi for e3 for 30 mins was terrible. even then they asked for passport before i got the code which i have never had to do before. One good thing is the hotels location however that doesn,t make up for the treatment i have since recieved

Reviews.Title: “Appalling service”
Reviews.Author: olddogmusic
Reviews.Content: Average noisy rooms, with bits missing. Old dated TV's and service that'd make Basil Fawlty look like...well...Mother Theresa! Breakfast was cold salami, stale bread and spilt cappucino's...all served with a scowl. Wouldn't recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel but you get what you pay for.....”
Reviews.Author: IreSteKet
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Virgilio for 5 nights at the start of August and all in all it wasn't a bad choice Positives first; very clean which is most important.Very decent location for getting to the main sights in Rome, 5/10 minutes stroll to Termimi Station, San Maria Maggiore,Trevi Fountain, Colosseum. Staff were friendly enough and there was an excellent restaurant directly across the street called Pasta Love which we really enjoyed and proved very handy. Oh and the rooms were basic but comfortable. Bed nice and firm. Tiny TV but if you've come to Rome to watch TV you're in the wrong city don't mind wrong hotel ha! Not so positives; we arrived late in the evening of the first night and were told there was an 'issue' with our booking so we were driven to another hotel down the road for our first night. It was to a 4 star hotel so that softened the blow but whether they run a policy of over booking and get caught out now and again or we were just unlucky, from reading some of the other reviews on this site, there is certainly an 'issue' with the booking system. That said they did get us sorted and organised our transfers at their expense. Breakfast was mundane for a 3 star. Walls were abit thin in the room we had so noisy neighbours made it difficult to sleep some nights! ...... snoring etc To sum up, this wasn't a bad little hotel at all. With so much to see and do in Rome, you only need a hotel for a base and a place to get some shut-eye. Hotel Virgilio did that with little difficulty and at little cost in a pretty expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “The staff doesn't like Americans.”
Reviews.Author: Phantom261
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice, but I had a problem with how rude the staff were toward me and my friend. I had gone to the lobby for a plunger, but the staff were unhelpful saying I would wait for a plumber. They didn't even attempt to look for one. I was polite about it and this one staff member gave me dirty looks. I apologized and said thank you; as I headed up the stairs to go to my room I heard the staff mocking me word for word in English.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, otherwise ok... but I'd keep looking.”
Reviews.Author: rand0m_pers0n
Reviews.Content: We got the standard room, and it was TINY. We couldn't open our suitcase properly. We may have just had bad luck, because we checked in late in the evening and got a room on the end of the corridor (room 118). The other standard rooms were apparently 1 square meter bigger. The internet is expensive - 3 euro for half hour even for wireless. The location was okay, about 5-10 minute walk to temini station. On the other hand, the breakfast was good, bathroom was nice and reasonable size, there was a TV in the room with cable access. Rooms were cleaned daily. I think it wasn't worth the money simply because we paid a reasonable amount and got a ridiculously small room. I think there is better value for money out there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, mixed review on the staff..”
Reviews.Author: heyman747
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel when I asked for a recommendation from the hotel locator service at the airport. They suggested we take a van to the Virgilio, which was not necessary, as the hotel is only a 15 minute walk from the Termini Station. The first impression is that the owner spent a lot of money on decorating the entrance and lobby area. The room we had was a reasonable size for a European hotel, but that means small by US standards. The bathroom was clean, and everything worked as it should, and the furniture was first rate. We did find the bed extremely firm, and that made the first night a long one. Massimo at the front desk was very helpful and solved our problem.One day the A/C didn't work, but Massimo got it taken care of right away. I saw the bad reviews on the staff, and I can understand, as the other front desk people were not as friendly as Massimo. The breakfast was something to look forward to in the morning, and I recommend it. I would likely stay here again if I wanted to be near the train station, but you could definitely get a larger room and save money if you were willing to be further out from the center. We did check out the Hotel Italia as it was highly rated on Tripadvisor, and was only a short walk from the Virgilio. The Virgilio definitely rates the extra star.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel exploited tourists who were stranded by the Volcanic Ash Cloud”
Reviews.Author: foxcub
Reviews.Content: No flights, no trains, no coaches, no rental cars, a long queue for whatever hotels were available and the cash machines ran out of money! This chaos was rather surprising given that the closure of airspace was in it’s fourth day. It was evening and we decided that we would store our baggage in the left-luggage and walk around to find a hotel, despite the humid heat. Fortunately, we found another hotel booking desk in the left-luggage hall and the queue was not quite as long. Whilst waiting in the queue we were approached by a hotel tout who offered us 2 nights accommodation for €320. Having been told that accommodation was scarce in the city we decided to take it and got a taxi to the Hotel Virgilio. When we got there we joined the queue of people to check in - only to be told that there was no more room at that hotel and we had been placed into another hotel - but we had to pay the Hotel Virgilio upfront as they had reserved the other hotels. We were as sceptic as the other travellers in the queue and all thought it to be a con, but we all decided to go along with it as it was now 9pm, we were hot and tired and getting desperate! Several of the travellers had been booked into a hotel 3km or more away but, luckily, ours was closer. We got a taxi to the Hotel Fiamma (near the station!) and stayed the night. In the morning, we had to check out by 11am and go back to the Hotel Virgilio We desperately tried to stay at the Hotel Fiamma to avoid the disruption of moving but were told that we couldn't. So off we trot to the Hotel Virgilio, left our luggage and came back later in the day when the room was ready. We stayed the one night - the breakfast was not good and not worth their normal rate of €80 a night - half of what we had paid! Basically, they profiteered from travellers in distress and didn't look after us but shunted us from one hotel to another.

Reviews.Title: “No problems here. I enjoyed my stay.”
Reviews.Author: sniktaw69
Reviews.Content: During my first visit to Rome I stayed at this hotel and was pleased. Coming from America where we are very particular when it comes to "ratings" and "expectations" , I found this hotel to be a great choice for the leisure traveller such as myself. So since I am planning to return to Rome later this year (December), I thoght I would look up this hotel again. I cannot recall having a bad experience at this hotel. I must admit though I was taken back a little when I had to pay the full cost of the room up front. But that was a minor thing considering I knew I had to pay the amount anyway. The staff was friendly and provided me and my friends with any information we needed to enjoy our trip. They suggested restaurants and other locations that may have been of interest to us. The room was clean and big enough for the 3 of us. With one bed as you enter the room and 1 larger or 2 additional beds down the hall. The location of the hotel was perfect for sight seeing, shopping and walking to major attractions. I think people need to realize that they can do more research for before travelling to find the best options for them. Like someone said, the hotel is less than a 10 minute walk from the train station. So it is just as easy and maybe takes less time to catch the train from the airport than a cab. I have travelled to several international locations around the world. Most being European locations. And it took me little time to realize that what we as Americans would call a 2 star hotel, maybe considered a 3 or 4 star hotel in Europe. So I know if I want luxury and top service I should stay at a major chain hotel and spend the money for it. But I do not always want that when I travel. I want to stay at a hotel that is clean, safe, reasonable in price and in a location that is close to the things I want to do. I have a family member that works for a major hotel chain, so I could get a room for a fraction of the cost of the regular room rate. At times my rate would be less than the rate of the hotel I select to stay in. All in all, I would stay at this hotel again based on my experience during my prior stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: TheHakes
Reviews.Content: Just spent 6 nights here with my husband and had a very pleasant stay after reading some bad reviews. Great location just 5 mins from metro and about 20 mins wlk from Trevi and the Colluseum and superb fish restaurant opposite. It was clean and we had a quiet room. The breakfast was fine and the staff provided any additional requirements quickly. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with terrible staff, breakfast, room. No hot water included.”
Reviews.Author: Nadia87
Reviews.Content: The first thing in this hotel that was strange- prepayment. It was the first in my travelling practice, but now I understand why. I would not come back in this hotel anymore. 1.We ordered a double room for me and my boyfriend, but manager offered us a room which are supposed to be for one person,but they squeeze another bed. So we hardly find place for our baggage. 2. Moreover breakfasts were very poor and we waited for 20 minutes for a woman who cleaned tables and brought coffee. 3.But the worst think was absense of hot water during morning hours. By the way I still have a cold. 4. And the last, but not the least was staff. In the hotel they offer transfaer to the aeroport for 50 euros, but normal taxi costs just 40 euros. Than I asked to order for me a normal taxi, he thought out that it would be very expensive for me etc. But of course he lied to me, because it`s wasn`t my first trip to Rome and I knew a fare. Of course money wasn`t the problem, the attitude was important. This hotel do not worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, overpriced hotel in a prime location.”
Reviews.Author: Tawandanessa
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the marble staircase and foyer, this hotel is anything but luxurious. This was the only hotel on our 5 week Europe trip that asked for payment upfront, and it didn't take long to see why. Tiny room (even for Europe), carpet not vacuumed, stains on bedspread, wardrobe doors didn't close properly, the wallpaper is peeling off in places, and the lift broke down at least once during our 3-night stay. After one night we asked to move to another room because the bed was too small and we were told it was a standard double bed and that all the rooms were like it. When we pushed the matter, we were offered another room but when we looked at it, the room and bed were exactly the same. The staff were unsympathetic and uncaring, and the poor girl running breakfast in the morning (who did a great job) received no help from the male staff around her, they seemed more content ordering her to do something else than actually lifting a finger to help. There was nowhere to place luggage in the over-furnished room (wardrobe, desk, chair, bedside table and another chair all along the hallway). Bed was too small for two people; my husband's feet hung off the end of the bed (he's only 5'11" in height), my toes could reach the end of the bed (I'm only 5'3"), and the bed only fit 1 1/2 pillows across. Window did little to shut out the noise of the restaurant across the street, and the walls were so thin you could hear people talking or watching TV in the next room which made for three very sleepless nights. Air conditioning worked well, though no controls in the room. Bathroom was clean and toiletries provided, and the shower pressure was good. The breakfast was ordinary at best. The breakfast room was tiny - not enough room for the number of guests, and all the breakfast was set up on one table so everyone had to reach over each other as they collected their breakfast. They offered bread and croissants (which were stale), cereal (either coco pops or sugared corn flakes), freshly made coffee to order, juice (sour grapefruit or miscellaneous fruit drink), yoghurt, boiled eggs, cheese, salami, ham, a variety of packaged items (salted biscuits like premiums, toast biscuits, cream cheese, butter and jams). Nothing was fresh except the coffee. We were aware that European breakfasts are generally not hot and quite light, but this wasn't even fresh. It's only redeeming feature was its location. Close to the main Roma Termini (approx. 10 minutes with luggage) and you can walk to all the major attractions (Coliseum and Roman Forum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Spanish Steps, perhaps not the Vatican City) easily. At 110 Euros a night it was not good value, and we would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “weekend break”
Reviews.Author: moskaLondon
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly staff,not helpful at all,no light in one of the bathrooms(was not fixed during the stay),walls in need of a coat of paint,no hot water the first day,then no heating during the night(in December!!!). Do not book a taxi for airport transfer through the hotel:we did,but the driver was NOT at the airport! Only good thing:location,but I assume there other hotels that are also centrally located and much better than this one. It is certainly not a 3* hotel,not even 2*. Very bad value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: scousemouse64
Reviews.Content: Clean and tidy hotel in a good location, close to all the sights. Very good continental breakfast that was plentiful, lots of choice and all fresh (the baker delivers every morning). We walked pretty much everywhere except to St. Peter's as that was a bit too far. However we were able to get a sightseeing trip from close by the hotel. Effecient staff, helpful but not overly friendly (typical roman's I think!) but gave us all the information we needed to know. Great location for a city centre break. I stayed with my mum for 4 nights and we had a great time. The room was comfortable, clean and had everything we needed but only italian telly, no english channels, which was okay with us as we were out and about most of the time. Within easy walking distance of the Internationale, where there's lots of shopping. There was plenty of great cheap restaurants in the side streets around the hotel and we could walk to most places. We felt particularly safe walking around at night, two women alone but we kept a tigh hold of our handbags during the day, particulary at the Vatican and the Spanish Steps which are notorious for pick pockets. A reasonably priced hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Tanya_T_UK
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews I was a little bit dubious about staying here - however we needn't have worried at all the hotel was fine, our room was spacious & very clean and had nice hot shower which was the main concern after reading what other people had written!! Hotel itself is in a great location only a few minutes walk into town & the main sights, for what we paid (£79 per night) I thought it was spot on, great place for coming back too & relaxing after a day out - not particularly glamorous etc but you get what you pay for, great value for a 3* star hotel in the city centre overall very good! I agree with the bad points about the breakfast it was very limited but it was nothing really to complain about - got a cup of tea & toast don't really need much more not gone there for the breakfast! .. Would definitely go back and stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: blackcountry
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife at the Virgilio for three nights last December,its in a great location and we found the room to be of a good standard the only thing we didn't like was the breakfast but there are plenty of great places to eat by the hotel.My son and his girlfriend stayed at the Trevi hotel at the same time I personaly preferred the Virgilio.We all enjoyed the trip and the sights and found that most things were in walking distance the open top bus is good value for money .Rome in December is very cold so if you go late in the year take a coat!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kittykatLisbon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. the receptionist Mr. Massimo was very nice, allways helpfull and smily. the breakfast is poor but the hotel's location is great. close to everything: transportation, museums, monuments, shops, restaurants. the room is nice , good for a 3 stars hotel. the price is a little bit expensive for a 3 stars hotel but even so it's worth concerning the location. great choise if you are just thinking of visiting the city and have a place just to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: naomiki
Reviews.Content: we got good rates for this hotel and picked it because it is centrally located. it is with a walking distance to many Rome attractions. the room is quite small, very small tv, but nice bathroom. Breakfast is quite boring (same things every morning), but they make their own capuccino. Our last 2 nights of staying were a bit annoying. We came back to the room after a long day and it wasn't eally neat. They hired a new chambermaid , and she broke the cover ot the toilet seat. Anyway, for a good price (less than 100 Euro per night), I would g for it again. Location is everything!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kea_Canada
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy sleeping on a box-spring like mattress, and don't mind the appearence of mold in your unsanitary shower, than this is the place for you. Not nearly the value and comfort that a "three star" should offer, we stayed here for; thank goodness only one night. Our room was delayed in being ready on time, and the elevator stopped working later that evening, so we tried the stairs only to find they don't go up to the third floor, so we waited over 15 minutes to get the lift working. I've stayed in hostals better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Honeyjj
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in a good place. You can walk to the Collosseum from it and also its in quite a quiet area. Only problem we had was they put us in a grotty tiny room to start, with paper thin walls (we were kept awake half the night by people talking next door) but they said they would move us the next night. Our new room was lovely, much more like it!! Would recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel, close to all main attractions”
Reviews.Author: Gwyneth006
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in a quiet street off the busy Via Natiozionale. The advantage of being so close to one of the main streets in Rome afforded convenient acccessibility to the bus routes and within walking distance of the metro at Piazza Republica. The location of the hotel also meant that you did not have to suffer any of the traffic noise that is usually experienced when situated directly onto a main road. The hotel itself was small and intimate. The staff were extremely friendly and efficient and spoke excellent English. The rooms were typically small for a city centre hotel but exceptionally clean with daily maid service. There was a safe in the room, suprisingly enough, you did not have to pay for the use of the safe key. My only criticism was the breakfast which consisted of rice crispies or cornflakes and milk, a bread roll with butter or preserve and a croissant. Drinks were juice, water, tea or coffee. This offering did not deviate for the 4 mornings we were there. Suffice to say after the second morning we made alternative arrangements in one of the many cafes surrounding the hotel. Rome was everything I expected it to be and more. I found the `Romans` generally helpful and friendly - a real contrast to the residents of Milan. Be prepared for an awful lot of walking - you will not see everything but if you plan for the sites you want to see and use the public transport system wisely - you will not be disappointed. A word of advice - all the literature about Rome will advise you about pickpockets. Having visited various cities across Europe and America, I would regard myself as quite cautious and sensible about my belongings, but Rome was something else, the excessive amount of people using the buses and metro system provide the crafty pickpocket with ample opportunity to steal your belongings as my partner experienced on our second day into the visit. Upon reflection, the theives worked in pairs, were very well dressed and extremely good at what they do. Fortunately, they only got away with about 50 euros as we had placed everything of worth in our hotel safe. Do not let this deter you from using what is otherwise a really efficient and quick way of getting around the city. The friendlieness of the other citizens of Rome restored my good opinion of the city and its residents. To experience a real Roman trattatoria, visit the Est Est Est across the road from the hotel. The Pizzas are to die for and the service was second to none. Finally, I would advise you to use the audio guides wherever possible as there is such a lot of information for the tourist to take in - audio guides are relatively inexpensive but main attractions such as the Collesseum, Roman Forum and Vatican Museum require you to provide identification i.e. passport, ID card, or a credit card. My advice would be for you to take something that you can use as ID but not of any real value. Useful tip - we purchased a 7 day pass which allowed us access on all public transport - cost 14 euro per person, this pass proved to be a pair of feets best friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Danny34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on a City Break in January. Young man on Reception was extremely friendly and spoke excellent English. Room was small but very clean - beds made, room cleaned and towels changed daily. I do not go on holiday to spend a lot of time in a hotel bedroom!! It was certainly 'fit for purpose' which is somewhere to sleep and leave my belongings. Breakfast wasn't fantastic but adequate. Location was excellent, within easy walking distance of practically all the attractions - we only used the bus to get to the Vatican on the other side of the Tiber. We arrived at Ciampino Airport and caught the shuttle bus (€1) from the Airport to Ciampino Railway Station then on the train from there to Rome Termini (€1.30) - very easy journey. Ryanair were offering bus tickets for €8 each way and the taxi is in the region of €30-40

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Thefamilytrip
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and two children, 16 and 11 stayed here for 4 nights and we found it to be neat and clean. The staff were helpful at all times. We had two neighbouring rooms which were not large, but adequate. The lift is tiny as are most that are retrofitted to old buildings in Italy, but that's part of the charm. I can stay in a US-style Hyatt or Hilton anywhere. The breakfast is delightful continental. The location is central - a short stroll from the Colloseum and Roman Forum, from Termini Station, and from the Trevi Fountain. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlossieWolverhampton
Reviews.Content: Having booked a short break at this hotel and then read several reviews which were not favourable we were rather concerned. However we found nothing to complain about. Young man on reception was always polite and helpful. We always had hot water and the breakfast was continental style but quite adequate. The hotel is smart and chic and in walking distance of several main tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “dump”
Reviews.Author: asss
Reviews.Content: Vile hotel, ignorant staff, room tiny complete ripoff. Got post-stay questionaire from venere, have never complained about anywhere before, gave thoughts not on venere website.

Reviews.Title: “central”
Reviews.Author: cariad9
Reviews.Content: first time for city break.be careful with taxis from airport.private cars are lot more exoensive as we found out.hotel was good.was a bit worried after reading negative things about it.the reception staff were very friendly .the lady staff was not very smiley but very efficient and helpful.our room was nice and light but overlooked a back courtyard.beds done every day but sheets not neccesary changed,towels were.breakfast was basic.tea or coffee,juice,croissants,cereals and hard buns jam etc.only neg was the shower was rather on the cooler side than we used to.turn left outside hotel and within minute you come to a nice snack bar with outside tables only and also takeaways.if you keep walking up road to top and turn right past the fountain in a square pass it ,keep walking you come to a nice restaurant called AMORE.we walked to the colloseum not too far.also walked to piazza novona.bit far but with stopping for drinks found it fun.really lovely here at night.you can get free maps from the tourist info kiosks.they will outline the routes for you.open air buses a must.you can get one day or two day tickets on red and blue buses.get on and off where you like and pick up on allocated times.rome is a lovely place and you cant possibly see everything.we did not use public buses as we were told to be carefull if they were packed of your personal belongings .there are loads of beautiful squares to be seen.we were here for 6 days and really enjoyed it .hopefully we will return to see more of rome.dont forget book your taxi back to airport in the hotel as it is cheaper cost us 48 eoros good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Cold Showers and Hot Shoes”
Reviews.Author: Kirkwood63122
Reviews.Content: April 26-29, 2007 We stayed at the Hotel Virgilio three nights this past April 2007. Not once was I able to take a hot shower during our stay - I was convinced that you either had to get up at the crack of dawn or shower after everyone had gone to bed! The desk attendant always seemed so dumbfounded by my dilemna. Oh well, I managed. But within 12 hours of checking out of the hotel, I realized that I had left a favorite pair of shoes in the room. We called the Hotel Virgilio and after a few searches they were able to locate my shoes and said they would hold them for me til we returned to Rome in a week. Upon our return to Rome, we made a beeline to the hotel and the shoes were missing. I was sick! Whether a sticky-handed chamber maid or just very poor management, I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. There are far too many to choose from!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: briers
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Hotel Virgilio - Very clean and comfortable rooms. Bathroom kept clean with towels changed frequently. Breakfast was very basic for the price - though the best cup of tea ever! Staff both friendly and helpful. Location was perfect - only 6 mins from Coloseum, 10 minutes from Trevi Fountain and 12 minutes from Spanish Steps. Vatican was just 30 minutes. I reckon that for the price this would be the best hotel close to all the sights. You could get a closer hotel but pay alot more and it wouldn't be worth it. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Never again, I hope”
Reviews.Author: CasualTravlR
Reviews.Content: I've stayed a few times in Rome and it seems that it is hard to find a reasonably priced hotel where one could achieve some level of mental comfort, let alone physical. In this one, I experienced: - a broken ventillator in the bathroom which was extremely loud and made for a very uneasy feeling when using the bathroom (it was switched on together with the light, so the other option was to use the bathroom in the dark) - a toilet which appeared not to be very well attached to the floor - loud noises on the corridor at night - a very cramped breakfast room, to accompany a poor breakfast menu (cereal, croissants, jam, orange-flavored drink). The place was reasonably clean and the staff were quite friendly although some very basic things were not obvious to them - like giving a receipt when having received payment (even if it was an advance payment) or providing a resonably secure place to keep luggage after having checked out but before heading for the airport. I stayed there one night and I was not expecting wonders, basically a place to get cleaned up, get a good night's sleep and have breakfast in normal conditions. That was too much to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: ecckles
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel based mostly on its location which was absolutely excellent!! 10 mins from the Trevi Fountain, Collesseum and Termini.We stayed here for 3 nights and definitely would stay here again. Staff were extremely friendly. Breakfast wasn't great, but typical of what you get in most 3 star hotels under "continental breakfast".Towels in hotel were not as bad as expected, actually seemed quite new and were changed daily. Bed was comfortable. Had to give deposit for safe key and air con/heating remote. Only Italian channels on tv. Overall good value, great location and would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lou&Gee
Reviews.Content: I read a few reviews before booking this hotel but only found the negative ones when I had already booked and paid... I then spent a good few weeks worrying about it. The hotel is situated just a few streets away from Termini Station. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by a very courteous and pleasant gentleman who checked us in which included restaurant recommendations, maps of the city and tour information - we were then left to get on with our holiday. Our room (128) was clean and smelt fresh; I decided to chance the rubbish towels and was rewarded with perfectly adequate ones. There was plenty of hot water to soak our aching muscles; the room was serviced everyday and was warm enough. There was a mini bar (with no price sheet so we didn’t bother!) and a TV; I don’t know whether we had satellite or not… I was in the beautiful city of Rome. All in all the hotel was fine; clean, comfortable and ideally located. The breakfast was ok – cereal, fresh bread and warm cornets (croissants) with a selection of jams or cream cheese, coffee and orange 'squash'. The staff were helpful but not overly friendly which we found to be the case in most places around the city. But who cares, we had a great time and I hope you do too!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Horrible Elevator”
Reviews.Author: Lycheeice
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on the location and other reviews. It was pretty close to the Roma Termini and easy to find. The room was decent size and clean. Breakfast was ok not great. The bed was hard, and the pillow too flat. The towel warning was right on; the towels were rough and more like napkins. My major complain was the elevator. It was very small to begin with, and you can barely fit two people with luggages. On our first night in this hotel, the elevator was skipping the ground floor, moving straight from basement (where the breakfast room was located) to 3rd floor (where most of the guests were staying since it was off season and only the 3rd floor was in use). After it skipped the ground floor for the third time, we decided to go down to basement to catch the elevator. Once we were inside the elevator, the door opened in between floors! And when it reached 3rd floor, the elevator stopped but the door didn't open. After about 10 seconds, the lights went off. Imagine getting stuck in the tiny elevator in total darkness! We stayed calm and pressed the alarm for assistance. We weren't in the elevator for that long, may be for 5 minutes or so, but the experience was definitely not what we had in mind. When the elevator started working again, it went straight down to the basement again. We stepped out of the elevator, glad that nothing major happened, and kindly asked the front desk if we could take the stairs instead. They told us there were no stairs to the 3rd floor (??), and our only option was to get back into that elevator. It took us a while to get the courage to step into the elevator again, but we finally managed to get back into our hotel room. We stayed a total of 3 nights in this hotel, and nothing happened again on the 2nd or 3rd night. If they didn't make us paid for the 3-nights up front, I would probably considered switching to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth returning”
Reviews.Author: bordercrossing
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located. Within walking distance of a number of historical places. We felt very safe walking on the streets. Recently renovated, our room was clean, up to date and had a certain freshness about it. The room was wallpapered in a dark green matting and was a touch ornate but, hey, we were renting the room not buying it. In our opinion, the hotel deserved its 3 star rating. The staff were good. Good shopping and many nice reastaurants around the area.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: faintly
Reviews.Content: great hotel in a central location, good clean rooms, take your own towels as hotel ones are like sheets, breakfast is continental but ok, staff very friendly and will help you out no problem. as for air con ask for the remote in hotel reception as no infor in hotel room we only found out when we were checking out!! this hotel is for couples or single people wouldnt recommend for familys

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, Overall Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Germany4us
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading several quite good reviews on Trip Advisor. It makes me wonder if someone connected with the hotel is writing the positive reviews--it was awful. First, they had us pay for three days in advance. We have stayed in hotels all over Europe and have never been asked to do this. Perhaps they have had some early departures so now they charge everyone in advance--I do not know. Second, the primary criteria was that the hotel have Air Conditioning--they assured us that it did. If it was present, it was not effective--our room never dipped below upper 80s F (lower 30s C). One helpful staff member told me that this happens on the third floor sometimes--but no apology or alternative. Then we were told to just leave the AC on all day and it would cool down. When we returned the maid had turned it off. The third day we asked the maid to leave on the AC but she said she had strict orders to turn it off and I would have to speak to the manager (owner?). I did this and he said it would be left on...we returned and it had AGAIN been turned off. Again, we have lived in Europe for over 2 years and stayed in many European hotels--never have we experienced anything like this. Third, breakfast was adequate but not always fresh. The juice was watered down and the coffee was luke warm. Oddly, there was a sign, only in English, not to take juice out of the breakfast room. Fourth, we had a junior suite and one room had a burned out light so reading was not possible. It took a day and a half to get the light bulb changed. Since we wanted the room to stay cool we kept the shutters closed...the room was as dark as the rest of the Hotel's atmosphere. Lastly, the staff was just not very friendly. Rome is beautiful...enjoy it from somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Caradog
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome where we stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Virgilio. It is a nice hotel and the staff was really helpful and friendly. We stayed in a small room on the first night and were moved to a bigger, newer room for the next 2 nights. The hotel is located within walking distance of all of the sites in central Rome, or if you don't like walking, there is a bus stop just a couple of hundred yards from the door. Breakfast was typical 3* continental with a selection of bread rolls, croissants, cereal, OJ, jams, and tea or coffee. There is a supermarket within a few minutes walk of the hotel, where we bought fruit and water to add to breakfast! The first room was cool enough but didn't seem to have aircon, although the second room did. There was a minibar in each room as well as a hairdryer and safety deposit box. As our flight was late in the evening, we were able to leave our bags in the hotel and to freshen up in a choice of two bathrooms, before departing. We would be inclined to stay here again if travelling to Rome as it is especially reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my wife's birthday, for a weekend (Sat/Sun/Mon) and would recomend it to anyone. The Hotel is set in a back street, but do not let this put you off, because it is quieter than staying on the main road. The location is great, we walked everywhere, the staff friendly, courteous, the breakfast normal fayre. The area is unaffected by the graffitti that plagues much of the city. The hotel was clean and modern, but small enough to feel quite exclusive. The lift is a bit rickety, but that's forgivable! I would recomend this hotel wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in June for 3 nights at this hotel. The first night we were given very small rooms with tiny bathrooms and a very small bed we were unhappy with this. The next 2 nights we were upgraded to a beautiful rooms, big bed, with big bathrooms it was great. When I booked the rooms I booked the larger but was given the smaller ones the first night. My husband and I took his parents and mine to Europe and we would definitely stay at this hotel again. Great location, very clean. We all were happy with the upgraded rooms. Ask for the ones on the higher floors and larger rooms when booking. If you get a smaller room, complain and asked to be moved. Had a great stay. We walked to everything except the Vatican. The metro was very close by and hotel was in a very nice and quiet neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really liked Hotel Virgillio. It's within walking distance to everything...except The Vatican...take a cab. The breakfast was mediocre but good enough for us....cereal and bread. The staff was very friendly except for the red headed lady....she gets really angry when you don't leave your key when you leave the hotel. If you are taking anything that needs to be plugged in to a two or three prong American outlet buy an adapter before you go...they are so hard to find. The blow dryer in our room looked like a vacuum hose and took forever to dry my hair. There was not a clock or phone in our room. Besides those few things we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was easily found from the Termini and I loved the decor. Smaller than I expected but this was the only let-down, although breakfast was not overly impressive. Other than that, I loved it - it was close to everything(you really could not actually hand pick a better place for staying in Rome,really) and very clean. Located on a quanit back street with lots of Italian charm,I would highly recommend it for anyone who has stayed in Rome before or particularly for first timers,like myself.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing.........”
Reviews.Author: Galena_8
Reviews.Content: We have read so many positive reviews about this hotel and frankly the hotel was very disappointing. The photos we saw on the internet when searching for a hotel and found Virgilio were so beautiful on line that we had to go there. What we found was totally different. The hotel iteself was ok but not what we thought it should have been according to the photos on line. I don't believe this hotel should be a 3 star but maybe a 2 star. The rooms were ok, could be a little cleaner. The breakfast was awful i.e., watered down orange juice, not so fresh rolls. Nothing looked appetizing. Hotel Virgilio is way over-priced and the staff could have been a little more friendly and helpful with the exception of one woman staff member who went out of her way to answer our questions and suggest places to go. She was very professional and friendly. Over all, We were not comfortable and didn't feel welcomed. I would not go back or recommend this hotel to anyone. There are much better hotels in the area. One good thing is the location. Other than that there's nothing positive to say.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for short stay”
Reviews.Author: aetravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the last 2 nites of my vacation in Italy--May 2005. The street was quiet and centrally located to all the sites. The hotel lobby looks a little dated and the breakfast area is very small. Breakfast was bad---the coffee was undrinkable. Our room was okay in size and cleanliness and the bathroom looked new. Overall its a good place to stay for a few days--any longer and i'd try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Helen019
Reviews.Content: We have just spent three nights at the Virgilio. This was our first time in Rome. Very quiet street but so close to everything- we spent a few hours walking around the first evening & saw the Trevi fountain,Colosseum ,the Forum & walked all along the main street ,Via Nationale without it seeming any effort at all.Also felt very safe in that area even at midnight. Our room was quite sparsely furnished but in a decorative'Roman'style.Some lightbulbs didnt work & shower curtain was missing a hook,but that didnt deter from the absolute cleanliness-lovely white cotton sheets & towels. Room serviced every day.Staff were polite when approached-especially Marco on the desk.Pretty ,tiny breakfast room-not much choice-but everything fresh & adequate.Cutlery & linen spotless- in fact cleanliness all around made up for small faults. Our room,204,was a reasonable size but we did glance a few that were really tiny!Would recommend this hotel as a comfortable central base for exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and clean comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: EdwardD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of November for two nights. I feel some comments posted here are a little unfair. Our room had recently been refurbished in a pleasant modern/classic style, the bathroom was small but again tastefully tiled. As we were short on time the concierge booked us on a guided tour for the afternoon of our arrival which was fabulous. We didn't pay over the odds either! Yes, the Hotel is 3 star and the breakfast consists of rolls and coffee - what do you expect on the continent. The hotel is very clean and comfortable and in walking distance of all the major attractions. I would recommend anyone planing a short break to stay here great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice people”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews after I had booked this hotel, I was a little concerned being a lone female traveler on a first trip to Rome. I was pleased, however, to find the desk staff extremely helpful and welcoming, even sorting out my planned tours for me. The hotel was well located and a great santuary after the miles of walking! I did not try the breakfast, preferring to sample the real Rome life in the cafes. I wouldn't rate the hotel any higher than average, but if you expext a comfortable warm bed for the night, hot running water and cleanliness, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “The worst breakfast in Europe - terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read some good reviews of this hotel which is why I picked it, but we were bitterly disappointed. The service was brash (to be expected in Rome) the air-conditioning made an irritating noise all night, the hot water was luke warm every morning. Despite complaints, nothing was done. we were told to take a shower at another time!! And the breakfast was vile. The coffee was SO bad it was undrinkable, the tea was weak and flavourless, the orange juice was watered down cordial and the breads hard and horrid. I would definatley NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. Having said that the beds were fine, and the room was clean. Others have obviously had a better experience here or their expectations were lower, but we did not have a good stay. This hotel needs to lift its game, serve a decent breakfast and treat their guests with respect. I cannot believe it calls itself 3 stars. Horrid.

Reviews.Title: “Just like th others said..”
Reviews.Author: PatrickTravels
Reviews.Content: As all the others have said, great location for the money (175 euros on Saturday, around 110 other nights). But also as others have said you can expect double booking and no refund. We arrived on a Saturday night and Andrea gave us a story about someone in the hospital who was unable to check out. They sent us to another hotel that was charging customers 25 euros per night less. I know because as I stood at reception at Hotel Corona (the Crown but far from regal) they were quoting walk-ins a price of 150. And Corona was not even worth 150. When we returned to Virgilio on Sunday morning our room (a very nice room) was ready but they refused to refund the 25 euro difference because they claimed it was what they paid. Now I have to tkae it up with Visa. So my advice is DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR CREDIT card until you get your room. If they send you to another hotel pay that hotel directly and do not give Virgilio your money. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “standard fare but one small problem”
Reviews.Author: chinaflyer
Reviews.Content: Just come back from this hotel stayed 4 nights 17th sept to 20th sept 2005. Its a very good location on a quiet street which runs parallel to via nazionali. Our one and only problem was when we checked in (very late on the morning of the 18th). Picked up the keys and given a room on the first floor. This is the smallest "double" i have ever seen, i'm 5 foot 8 ins and my feet was sticking out the end of the bed, so not the tallest, also the bed was against the wall so access was only available from one side. We complained immediately but they could do nothing as the hotel was full. The next morning we spoke to the manager who upgraded us to a superior room ( normal size in anybodys view) for the rest of our stay. No way we were getting any refund. All in all for 464 pounds not brilliant, but within reach of all the sites in about 20 minutes walk, clean, typical breakfast (why they can't have proper orange juice i don't know). and a short walk from the termini.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Virgilio and were very happy with our choice. The room and the bathroom were relatively basic but clean and everything worked. The hotel was quiet, which was great, and whilst not entirely centrally situated, was within easy reach of everything we wanted to see. My only real gripe would be that the breakfast was horrible. The coffee turned green when we put milk in it, the orange juice was squash and the pastries were inedible. But then you don't go to Rome to worry about your hotel breakfast! Would recommend it to anyone who wants a basic hotel in a good position in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on a quiet side street”
Reviews.Author: Inky2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in May 2005 and found this a very clean and quiet hotel with friendly staff. The hotel is located on a quiet street just off the busy Via Nazionale and is in easy walking distance of many of the attractions in Rome, especially the Piazza Venezia, the Colosseum and the Santa Maria Maggiore. The rooms are clean and tidy and the staff friendly and helpful. If I have one 'moan' (and it's not one that spoilt our stay here), it is that the breakfast is a little limited in choice - no meats or cheeses included. But that's a minor point as I would fully reccommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Virgilio the weekend of 21st May. The hotel has a very pleasant ambiance. A real Roman style. Although at first we were booked in a extra small room because there were some problems with some other rooms, the second night we were upgraded to a "suite". Rooms are clean and decorated with marble and fine wood. The breakfast was included and above average. Receptionist Helga was a knock out!! We advice this hotel to couples who want to stay a short period in Rome(i.e. weekend) and who want to see most of the tourist things. We did everything on foot and were able to see the big 5. Virgilio: You will see us again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value 3 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the Virgilio very clean and the breakfast was of above average. The room was quite and the hotel is based in a side street but only a few minutes walk from most places of interest. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and found location excellent, close to restaurants and main attractions. The hotel itself is in quiet area off via Nazionale about 10 mins from the Main Train Station. The facilities were adequate for a three star although there was constant noise on the third floor where we stayed. The staff were efficient although a little pushy to recommend the shuttle to the airport and bus tours to be booked with them which seemed expensive compared to trains and going to bus company direct. The breakfast is hardly worth the trouble. We booked a superior room which seemed small but understand this may be common in Rome. At Euro 380 it appeared to be expensive although for the location this may be average price. Overall it served its purpose, the excellent location being the main advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Good but overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: _Wanderer__24242_
Reviews.Content: I and my mother stayed at the hotel in November 2003 for two nights. The hotel is a good 3 star hotel: spacious room and bathroom, everything very clean, normal breakfast (according to Italian standards). The location is not bad: approximately half way between Termini and the Roman Forum. We stayed in November and it was quite cold in the room, as heating was switched off. Therefore, we had to ask for additional blankets from the reception. Another minor problem was the hot water: it took a while (15 min) before it actually became hot. At the same time, I cant say that at 90euro per night that we payed the hotel was a good value for the money. In that area of Rome, one can certainly get all the same at a lower price (around 70-75 euro for a double). But apart from the price, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: nikki9798
Reviews.Content: While in Rome, my husband and I and his daughter and her husband stayed at the Hotel Virgilio. I booked this hotel because of the good reviews I saw on Trip Advisor. While looking to book hotels in Rome, the prices were very high. Hotel Virgilio was a moderately priced hotel that gave better than average service and was very acceptable. The hotel is very centrally located. We walked to all the major attractions with no problem. We actually walked all the way to Vatican City from the hotel. This took around 30 to 40 minutes but was well worth it. The sights along the way distracted us from how long it ws taking. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a room fit for all 4 of us. 1 king bed and 2 single beds. The bathroom was great. Exceptionally clean with a great shower. It looked as though it had been recently remodeled. The room was also clean. Television was provided and CNN in English was one of the channels. Breakfast was included in the price. It was not what we Americans are used to for breakfast but it was very good. The Italian coffee we drank was outstanding. Still wondering what it was. The only thing stopping me from giving this hotel an excellent rating is the comfort of the beds. It was like sleeping on a slate floor. We ended up folding the bedspreads up and sleeping on top of them for some cushion. We only stayed 2 nights and thank goodness for that because none of our bodies could have taken another night on those beds. Overall, it was a great place to stay while in Rome. If we went back, I would stay there again and will recommed it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 28th march 2005 for 2 nights, the week of the Pope's death. We had a twin room with nice, clean and comfortable beds. It was a strange thing that the room was in good order except two pieces of cornice on the ceiling were missing, the bedside light was hanging off the wall and the bed settee in the corner was very tatty. It was a shame as these small jobs are such easy things to rectify. The breakfast was fine and the staff were friendly and helpful. We went on a couple of tours recommended by the hotel and the location is so near to the buses, trains and metro which we negotiated with ease to the Vatican. Lots of places like the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and the Coliseum are within walking distance if you are fit! We even walked home from the Piazza Navona!! which has a great atmosphere and good food. I would recommend the horse drawn carriage ride but make sure you negotiate the price before you get on. The prices range from 50-100 euros! Our driver then asked for some more when we got off!! All in all I would recommend this hotel and a quick compact visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Bet for Rome”
Reviews.Author: NaMakani
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in September 2004 and recommend it highly. As mentioned in other reviews, the location is excellent -- only a block from a main street and buses, or an easy walk to the main train/bus station. On a side street that is pleasant and quiet, though the rooms (ours faced the street) are well insulated against the sound. We had a large room, somewhat sparsely furnished, with a very large marble-encrusted bathroom and good sized shower. There was very little counter space in the bathroom, but this is common in Italian hotels. Good breakfast buffet with fruit and cereal available. Staff were friendly and helpful (they helped with some lost luggage), though they did not know much English. It seems the entire hotel has recently undergone rennovation, making everything seem extraordinarily clean and attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and peacful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Quiet and peaceful and yet very close to the main Nationale ( handy for buses), comfortable and clean rooms, has just been refurbished. They were finishing off tiling the floor when we were there. the only gripes we had were the breakfast was very basic and a very small bar. Try the Dolci & Dolcezze just up the road for a snack very nice

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: hotel in good location ,but on the day we arrived we were not allowed in our rooms untill 18.00 hours. cleaning was very hit and miss one day 1 of our rooms wasnt cleaned at all towels would be taken away and not replaced ,breakfast was very basic and not good quality we booked this hotel as it advertised its own bar but they do not open the bar only when asked but when we asked a very grumpy member of staff let us in but then left and no one turned up to serve.we found staff very unhelpfull and would not rerurn to this hotel.but rome was lovely
